overview: The honours program in Architecture History, Theory and Criticism gives students the opportunity to complete an advanced course of study,  including an independent research project on an area of interest approved by the specialisation coordinator.
Students must achieve a minimum of 65% in all subjects in order to qualify for the awarding of an honours degree.

Subject Options.ABPL40054: Bachelor of Design Honours Thesis-I Credits
Subject Options.ABPL40055: Bachelor of Design Honours Thesis -II Credits

Subject Options.ABPL90282: Principles of Heritage and Conservation Credits
Subject Options.ABPL90355: Issues and Techniques in Global Heritage Credits
Subject Options.ABPL90336: Craft in Traditional Asian Architecture Credits

Students undertaking honours in Archite: Bachelor of Design Honours Thesis (50 points), consisting of Bachelor of Design Honours Thesis part 1 (12.5 points) and part 2 (37.5 points)
